TopicTitle: [0.23.5] Spherical and Toroidal Tank Pack (Updated 05/02/14) (New download link)

Articles.Content:
http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/45070-TT-s-IVA-Tutorial

There, I helped.

I would love a two or three seat pod with seats oriented in different directions... so you could have a forward looking window for flying, and a lander-can-style window for looking out to the side and downward while landing.

That's actually how I envisioned the pod, the middle seat would be oriented to look to the side/down out of the raised cockpit for landings while the two outer seats face "up" for launches.

*sigh* you guys are gonna make me learn to build IVA's aren't you?

Oh absolutely

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/45070-TT-s-IVA-Tutorial

There, I helped.

Lol, I don't know if "helped" is the right word... Now I see that I know even less about this process than I thought. I've got some learnin' to do!

So, there's been a few downloads of the test version and I haven't heard any complaints about it so I assume it's working . I think I'm going to move it towards official release. I'm going to split the tanks so that there's a set for the various fuels in the propulsion tab and a set for other resources (rocketparts, oxygen, etc) in the utilities tab. I may also rework the toroidal tank pack to use the plugin system and add them all to the same pack.

One question though, I was looking at where I should add them into the tech trees. I was thinking either all in the big "experimental rocketry" tab, but that adds them all at the very end. My other thought is to add the smalls at "heavier rocketry", mediums at "very heavy rocketry" and the large ones at "experimental rocketry".

Any thoughts on this, or feedback on the test version would be appreciated, so I can do a final release with as few "fix-it" updates as possible.

Been playing with this today. Holy crap. Best Mod Ever. I want to retrofit all the other tanks with your code. I love how it reduces the part count and makes things customizable, but its not OP. I put them all in the tech tree way high up, your plan sounds good.

-Seyv

Probably just personal preference, but I prefer the fuel and texture switching supplied by Stretchy Tanks and I couldn't help noticing it's on a sharealike licence...

With this in mind I have been looking at his plugin and have started stripping it down for use with this mod. If you want to use it when I'm done I'd be more than happy to supply it to you (Just need to credit the original author and myself) but if not I'm happy to keep it for my own use

I prefer the one thats in this pack. Why do you like the strechy one better?

Tal i played around with it, no complains. The textures on the bigger tanks get a little washed out when stretched but its all good.

I noticed this as well. This can be fixed by raising the resolution of the large tank textures, but I decided to leave it as is in order to keep the mod size down as much as possible. Actually, the small tanks texture resolution could probably be lowered without being able to notice too much of a difference.

Been playing with this today. Holy crap. Best Mod Ever. I want to retrofit all the other tanks with your code. I love how it reduces the part count and makes things customizable, but its not OP. I put them all in the tech tree way high up, your plan sounds good.

Thanks for this! All the credit for the plugins goes to the original authors. All I did was cherry pick the plugins that would accomplish what I was looking for from a couple of my favorite mods and use them together to accomplish this.

Probably just personal preference, but I prefer the fuel and texture switching supplied by Stretchy Tanks and I couldn't help noticing it's on a sharealike licence...

With this in mind I have been looking at his plugin and have started stripping it down for use with this mod. If you want to use it when I'm done I'd be more than happy to supply it to you (Just need to credit the original author and myself) but if not I'm happy to keep it for my own use

I think that the major benefits to the plugins I used are that:

1) With Modular Fuels you can put any mix of any fuels into the tank. For example, you could have a single tank hold LiquidFuel, Oxidizer, and Monopropellant in any proportions you like or you could have separate tanks for each. Also, adding new fuels to the tanks is now just a matter of changing one resource config instead of changing each individual tank's config. It's a bit more flexible for customization, I feel.

2) This is just personal preference, but I prefer having a GUI to switch the texture rather than holding a key and clicking to change it. This can also be easily expanded to be able to switch both the band colors and the tank colors (if I ever get other textures for them made up) independent of each other.

I haven't really looked at the Stretchy Tanks plugin much, so I'm not completely aware of it's capabilities. I'd definitely be interested in seeing how it works when you're done though!
All right. Pack has been updated to combine spherical and toroidal packs, both enabled by the plugins. Main post updated. I'm taking cover!

That won't be too hard. I'll grab his mod and add those resources to the storage tanks later today. This has been requested before, so I should have thought of it already.

Great update! The new design really cuts down on part clutter in the VAB.

One bug I noticed: the toroidal hubs don't appear to be placed in the tech tree.

Great update! The new design really cuts down on part clutter in the VAB.

One bug I noticed: the toroidal hubs don't appear to be placed in the tech tree.

Good catch. I was intending on adding them all to the heavier rocketry tier. I'll get that in the next update. Thanks for pointing that out to me.
OOOOOOOOOH Im excited about the new changeable tanks!

First, thanks for this mod. I really like how you have updated it...

Next, is there a easy way to fill the tanks to some lesser amount, say 10% of 'full', but where it calculates the correct amounts based on that percentage??? I have been trying to do this, with first option, LF Oxi, and i dont see any 'automated' way to do this. I can do the calculations, but i was guessing that you might had put a automatic method in there somewhere.

if not, no problem... just checking.

and again, thanks.
Put an engine below it. Then the ratio for that engine should appear as a preset.

Thanks NathanKell.... But maybe my question did not come over as i wanted. I have built a ship with one of the spherical tanks and engine. it has the correct ratio and amount for FULL tank. 17279/17279 LF and 21119/21119 Ox. I wish to knock this down to only be partially full, so i change the LF down to 10000/17279 and here is where i am looking for way to have it automatically adjust the Ox to the correct amount now that i have reduced the LF. I can get my calculator and compute what the 'new' amount of Ox should be, i was just wondering if there was a way to have it automatically adjust the amount of Ox base on the fact that the LF had been reduced.

I am guessing that it does not recalculate for this, and that the Update button only stores what has been entered....

Again, thanks for any help...

Remove all tanks. Add a single tank of type NOT LF or OX. Set its volume to the amount of volume you want to leave unfilled.

Then autofill with LF/OX.

Then remove your placeholder tank.

very nice...... thanks indeed.

It might be nice to have a 'recompute' option to do that with out the empty tank trick at sometime....

again, thanks.

Minor update to the pack. Here's the changes:

v3.01 (minor update)

- Added toroidal hubs to career mode technology tree

- Added support for TAC Life Support mod resources to storage containers

Resources for TAC Life Support mod were balanced using the large cylindrical containers in Taranis Elsu's mod. (and thanks for the ok to add the resource support to my tanks!)

Edited October 23, 2013 by Talisar
This keeps getting better and better! I like the new textures, now I won't have to use the ones I made that the mapping was off on the bands.
